bwwExcerpt: “Monty Python and the Holy Grail,” of course, was not a big-budget project and “Spamalot” needn’t be either. But if you can’t afford to be spectacular, like Mike Nichols’ original production was, then make the design clever and funny. Nope. This one settles for mere functionality. It’s yet another missed opportunity for the revival to be something at least a little different.
dtliExcerpt: The show feels like comfort food — familiar, warm and satisfying, even if it's not particularly challenging or groundbreaking.
